sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>leaf</radical> has to do the same <radical>task</radical> <kanji>again</kanji> and again. Grow out of a tree, change color, fall to the ground, get absorbed back into the tree, then start all over again.
meaningInfo: Picture all of the tasks a leaf has to do in its lifetime again and again.
readingMnemonic: Once <kanji>again</kanji> the leaf picks up a <reading>saw</reading> (<ja>さ</ja>) and cuts itself off of the tree at the end of fall, like some kind of invincible <reading>cy</reading>borg (<ja>さい</ja>).
readingInfo: Picture a leaf sawing itself off of a tree. Then picture it again. Now picture Bill Nye pointing to it and saying, "This leaf is a cyborg. See how it has little robot parts, allowing it to do this again and again?"
